data.title: Our Ultimate List: 101 Education Blog Post Ideas
data.meta_description: Finding it hard to think of educational blog topics to write about? You're not alone. Check out our top 101 topic ideas for the education industry here.
data.text:
With the growth of technology has come a shift in the presentation of academic material from traditional books and papers to online lessons and classrooms. This shift has given birth to educational blogging, a practice that provides support not only for students but also for teachers and parents. Academic blogging plays a significant role in promoting digital literacy, providing hands-on lessons in skills that include coding, researching, troubleshooting, and keyboard shortcuts.

Educational blogging is especially important given the level of importance that technology holds in most students’ lives. Limitations of distance and limited resources can be overcome by employing the intricacies of educational blogging to share information with students worldwide. In addition, teachers and tutors encourage further brain development by encouraging students to join in on academic blogging activities as research has found that regular writing enhances the brain’s performance.

Uniquely crafted educational blogs can also encourage creativity in both students and teachers. Additionally, the creation and presentation of information via blogging help build and promote self-confidence by allowing students and teachers to discover their niche. Increased levels of confidence can also lead to better levels of communication and interaction.

Educational blogging is a relatively untouched resource with endless benefits and possibilities that we have outlined by providing our readers with one hundred unique educational blogging topics. However, even with our provisions of subjects, academic blogging does still require time and effort. Time and effort that you won’t have to invest by taking advantage of our easy-to-use blog writing service. With the world of educational blogging at your fingertips, not taking advantage of this offer would be a mistake.

Education Blog Post Ideas

Some of the most popular blog post ideas for students and teachers include:

Interview With A Professional

With the potential to be carried on as a series, interviews focused on professions your students are interested in can provide valuable future insight while keeping them interested.

Tips And Tricks For New Educators

Creating a bullet point article or leaving anecdotes of how experienced teachers resolve specific issues with students can be a valuable resource that will bring readers to your blog.

The Impact Of Social Media On The Classroom

Allowing teachers to outline their own thoughts and involve students by encouraging them to feed into the topic can be an excellent way to open discourse and promote communication.

Choose Your Own Ending Sociology Lessons

By creating a blog that allows students to honestly discuss and reason the impact of specific actions linked to real-life situations, teachers can encourage engagement and information retention.

Online Resources For Teachers

By creating a blog that lists resources teachers can utilize, you can encourage other teachers to view your blog and allow parents access to resources that can help with home learning.

Create A Book Review

Students are often unsure how to structure reviews, especially if they are new to the practice. By creating one, teachers can provide students with outlines to help them write their own.

Mental Health Is Important

Create a blog that outlines ways teachers, and students can address and cope with mental health issues. Consider leaving links to reputable mental health resources.

Opposites Day

Try something entirely outside of your scope and review your experience. This can encourage students and other teachers to try new activities and be less critical of themselves.

A Step Back In Time

Write about a piece of old technology like a floppy disk and then compare it to its modern counterpart. This proves an interesting look at the journey of technology.

Find An Interesting Ted Talk Then Review It

This encourages critical thinking in your students while allowing them to take in other resources such as the Ted Talk, which should be embedded in your blog.

Area Focused Historical Posts

Capture the attention of your students and local populace by creating a blog about a landmark, business, or person with historical significance and encouraging readers to add their own accounts in the comments.

Job Growth Discussion

Create a blog outlining your career journey, from your first day on the job to the present time. This will support students wishing to try something new, allowing them to see progress is possible.

Myth Buster Blogs

This is especially helpful for science topics. Target a popular myth or misconception, explain why it is incorrect, and if possible, suggest other possible explanations for the occurrence.

Answer Popular Quora Questions

By using Quora, teachers can get insight into the current interests of those in the same demographic as their students. Answering these questions might make a teacher seem more approachable and relatable.

Inspirational Quotes Compilation

Create lists of inspirational quotes that can be used by teachers and students alike. To make it even more interesting, you can include pictures and embedded videos.

Create A How To Pick Your College List

This is extremely important for students who are unwilling to seek help via face-to-face interactions. By outlining what college applicants should look for, you can draw in both students and parents.

Current Events Posts

Create a post about a current event that you feel will encourage your students’ critical thinking. Allow for discussion but remember to promote respect.

Adventure Vlogging

Create a blog about a specific location that your students can’t easily access on their own and include a vlog of the area, tying information and visual stimuli together.

Esports Discussion

Create a blog discussing the rising popularity of Esports and encourage readers to discuss what impact they believe this industry might have on traditional sports forms. This is a good topic for Physical Education teachers.

Behind The Scenes Of Films And Theatre

Research then create a blog that provides information about the processes behind the production of films and theatre. This is particularly helpful for teachers of the arts and drama.

Teacher For The Day

Create a blog post that suggests topics and allows students to present videos on that topic. This promotes communication between students and is a good confidence builder.

Replicate A Parody Post

Check Twitter or Reddit for trending funny parody posts. You can either use the post to prompt discussion of the topic or create your own funny parody post with questions tailored to encourage discussion.

Case Studies

Highlight an exciting case study of a successful business or famous person and allow your students to brainstorm other routes they could have taken to success.

Discuss Financial Aid

Teachers often have insights into the process of obtaining financial aid and scholarships. Use this information to create a blog to help your students and their parents get on the right track.

Meme Analysis

Write a blog on the impact of memes. Include several examples and encourage your students to discuss their own theories or suggest memes they know about.

Parent-Teacher Communication

Create a blog that outlines the correct way to communicate with both parents and teachers. Outline appropriate procedures and questions and include contact information for your facility if required.

Discuss the Pinterest Perfect Classroom

Discuss the science behind the idea of a perfect classroom and encourage students to discuss whether they believe that a classroom’s design can help with learning.

Talk About Your Hobbies And Interests

Allow your students and readers an insight into your personal life by creating a blog about your hobbies. Outline the processes that you follow and the equipment you might use.

What If Scenarios?

Use a famous celebrity or historical figure and suggest a respectful change in career or life path. Allow your students to suggest how this change could affect the individual’s life and the course of history.

Holiday Trivia

This is especially helpful for history and sociology. Pick a popular holiday, create a blog about its origins, how it has changed over the years, and the possible reasons why.

Pop Quiz Bonanza

Create a blog consisting of multiple educational questions. Assign points to each question and allow your students to answer them. Then, tally up the answers and assign appropriate rewards.

Study Techniques

Make a list of tips and tricks that students can use to help them retain the information they have studied. Include fun video examples to break up the text.

Parent’s College Guide

Create a guide of what parents should expect in the lead up to college, include helpful resources and any anecdotes you can find to make the post more relatable.

Early Education Handbook

Craft lesson plans and fun interactive games for preschool teachers and parents. Include printable resources and timetables to help guide your reader.

Lunchlady Practices

Find simple and healthy recipes that parents and children can accomplish together and compile the list presenting it on your blog along with any nutritional facts.

Homework Hero

Leave tips and tricks that parents can employ to encourage homework completion. Also, link any resource that can help parents better understand their children’s homework or find help if they are stuck.

Transportation Network

Create a blog outlining safe bus practices, how to find appropriate transportation, and the rules of picking up or dropping off students in your local area.

School Schedule Secretary

Another local blogging idea, create a blog that outlines holidays, start times, and dismissal times, along with information on how to report a student’s absence.

Penny Pinchers

Create a list of your local supermarkets and stores that offer deals and bargains to simplify shopping for parents. Focus on food items used in lunches or businesses that provide discounts on stationery and school clothing.

School Trip Advisors

Identify important historical or enjoyable locations for class trips that teachers can take advantage of. Include the contact information of the places included in the blog to make scheduling easier.

Fundraising Ideas

With increasing classroom equipment and materials costs, fundraising ideas can garner much attention on education blogs. Listing ideas and providing tutorials can aid parents and teachers alike,

Homecoming Themes

Providing a blog that caters to homecoming theme ideas is another way to pull in a reader base. All that is needed is a list with the name of the themes and pictures representing the themes suggested.

Ways To Address Bullying

Bullying is a growing problem in most schools, with the effects spreading into the technological hemisphere. Presenting ways to address these issues and educating others on the impact of bullying is a brilliant blog idea.

Online Parents Resources

Create a blog that explains online classrooms and how to monitor students’ progress via the internet for parents who are not as technologically savvy.

Green Thumb Mania

Encourage students to pay more attention to their environment by creating a blog that not only outlines the effect of pollution but also outlines what students can do to combat this issue.

The Poetry Corner

Encourage creativity by creating a blog containing famous poetry pieces and include your own attempts to encourage your students to do the same.

Ancient History 101

Choose a focal point in history and provide information about it, then request that your students create articles or stories created around the focal point identified.

Inspector Clues

Create a mystery that can only be solved by finding hidden clues in several passages. Assign reward points for each clue and watch your students become investigators.

Stay At Home Scientist

Outline simple yet enjoyable science experiments that can be done safely at home in the presence of a parent. Allow students to report the results of their experiments on your blog and provide feedback.

Music Mayhem

Create a blog where you identify a song and interpret the meaning behind the lyrics. Provide your students and readers with the chance to identify a piece for themselves and try their hand at understanding it.

50 More Education Blog Post Ideas
